# Estimating $\pi$

## A circle

Consider a circle of radius $R$ centred at the origin.

:::: {layout="[ 80, 80 ]"}

::: {#10d654aa .cell execution_count=1}

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![](TEsting_files/figure-html/cell-2-output-1.png){width=609 height=429}
:::
:::


::::


The equation of the circle is given by
$$
x^2+y^2=R^2.
$$ {#eq-circle}

The area of the circle is given by the familiar formula

$$
\pi R^2.
$$

The smallest square within which the circle can be inscribed will have side length $2R$.

:::: {layout="[ 80, 80 ]"}

::: {#4d006be6 .cell execution_count=2}

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![](TEsting_files/figure-html/cell-3-output-1.png){width=609 height=429}
:::
:::


::::
